scenario:
Dominion Energy's forward dividend yield is around 5% with a payout ratio of 98.5%. The company is expected to deliver long-term operating earnings-per-share growth of 5-7% and has a history of maintaining its dividend. Dominion operates in three states with growing populations and has opportunities in data centers. The stock has pulled back due to the Federal Reserve's hints about fewer interest rate cuts.

Pfizer's forward dividend yield is over 6.5% and the stock trades at less than 9 times forward earnings with a PEG ratio of 0.2. The company has a strong lineup of new products and a promising late-stage pipeline. Pfizer's growth prospects are expected to be good despite losing patent exclusivity for several products.

United Parcel Service (UPS) has a forward dividend yield of 5.13% and a track record of 15 consecutive dividend increases. The company returned to revenue and earnings growth in the third quarter of 2024 and has moved past higher costs associated with its agreement with the Teamsters Union. UPS is focusing on higher-margin packages and aims to become the world's top healthcare logistics provider. The company's earnings are expected to grow strongly over the coming years.
